intro: Geranium pusillum var. elatum, commonly known as the tall geranium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, or white, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its compact growth habit and long blooming period make it a valuable addition to cultivated landscapes.
